name: Fundraisers and fundraising activities
text:
(a)  As used in this section, "fundraiser" means any function held for the benefit of a person that is intended or designed, directly or indirectly, to raise funds for political purposes for which the price or suggested contribution for attending the function is more than $25 per person.
     (b)  No fundraiser or fundraising activity shall be held unless a notice of intent to hold the function is filed by the person in charge of the function with the commission prior to the date of the function setting forth the name and address of the person in charge, the price per person, the date, hour, and place of the affair and the method thereof. [L 1979, c 224, pt of §2; am L 1980, c 232, §1 and c 246, §1(e); gen ch 1985; am L 1987, c 369, §1(6); am L Sp 1995, c 10, §2(9); am L 1997, c 375, §7; am L 1999, c 64, §2; am L 2007, c 200, §5]
